results.title: The Guide to 35mm photography
results.brief_description: Brian Ratty introduces this instructional video on how to use a 35mm camera. The program is divided into three half-hour chapters. Part one covers: How the SLR works, “f” stops and shutter speeds, exposure, depth of field and film. Part two covers: Lenses, available light, flash, filters and steady shooting. Part three covers: seeing with the camera, candids, portraits, the environmental portrait and sports and action.

results.title: Dumbo. Father Noah's ark. The Practical pig. Three orphan pigs.
results.brief_description: One of Disney’s most endearing animated films. Dumbo is the story of a baby circus animal born with oversized ears. Snubbed and ridiculed by all the other circus animals, he is befriended by Timothy, a small but spirited mouse. After Dumbo is involved in several disastrous performances under the big top, Timothy decides to launch Dumbo as a new star - the world’s only flying elephant. Also included in this program are three Disney cartoons: “Father Noah’s ark”, “The Practical pig”, and “Three orphan kittens”.
results.title_for_label: Dumbo. Father Noah’s ark. The Practical pig. Three orphan pigs.

results.title: Making of a legend: Gone with the wind
results.creator_credit: David Hinton, L. Jeffrey Selznick, Selznick Properties and Turner Entertainment
results.brief_description: A feature length documentary which takes a behind-the-scenes look at the making of the 1939 feature film “Gone With the Wind”. Utilises some rare film footage including several screen tests for the part of Scarlett O’Hara, and home movies featuring Vivien Leigh. A fascinating inside view of one of the great accomplishments in motion picture history. Narrated by Christopher Plummer.
results.title_for_label: Making of a legend: Gone with the wind
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Hinton, L. Jeffrey Selznick, Selznick Properties and Turner Entertainment

results.title: Keeping warm
results.brief_description: Examines the problems involved in keeping people warm. Humans generate their own body heat and try to keep warm by trapping heat next to the body with layers of clothing. Houses too need proper insulation if they are to retain the warmth from heating sources. This program looks at a computer- controlled house where getting up, having a bath and watching television happen to order; saving energy and money.

results.title: Penguin island: Australia's little penguins
results.creator_credit: Patrick Gillespie, Gordon Badham and BandG Communications
results.brief_description: Hosted by Peter Hoskings, this is a tourist orientated film that never the less provides a wealth of facts and figures about the fairy penguins, and background information about Phillip Island. Excellent cinematography reveals much about the scenary and wild life of the island including koalas, kangaroos and wallabies, wombats, seals, wild flowers and birds.

results.title: Taking action
results.creator_credit: James Mann and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description: This video has been prepared to assist and challenge people in positions of responsibility in schools to provide active and supportive leadership to staff by identifying issues of concern; creating openings for discussion; and taking action in creative, caring and supportive ways. Presents three case studies showing typical school situations in which work performance and organisational issues affect staff relations.

results.title: Winter's tale
results.creator_credit: Jane Howell, Jonathan Miller and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: One of Shakespeare’s later works, “Winter’s tale” was written in 1611. King Leontes of Sicilia suspects his wife of adultery with his friend the king of Bohemia. He orders that his new born daughter be left in a desolate place to die. The oracle of Apollo declares that Leontes will live without an heir and soon after his only son dies. The baby girl Perdita is found and raised by shepherds and grows to be loved by Florizel the son of the king of Bohemia. It is discovered that Perdita is the lost daughter of Leontes, and then he is happily reunited with his daughter, his wife Hermione, and his old friend the king of Bohemia. Produced by Jonathon Miller.

results.title: Raoul Wallenberg: between the lines [Edited version]
results.creator_credit: Karin Altmann, Bob Weis and Jethro Films Pty Ltd
results.brief_description: The story of Raoul Wallenberg, a Swedish diplomat living in wartime Budapest who displayed outstanding courage and ingenuity in rescuing Jews from the holocaust. An edited version of the 80 minute feature length documentary.
